intro: Haydenia haberiana, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in spring and are often arranged in a star-like pattern, giving it its common name. Haydenia haberiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
